title: King to strip Andrew of his final military title, minister says
byline: The government is “working to remove” Andrew Mountbatten Windsor’s last honorary military title at the King’s request, the defence secretary has said.

title: Mainly fair weather expected to prevail today
byline: Showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Sabaragamuwa, Central and Uva provinces after 2.00 p.m, today (03), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: 10 arrested in Kilinochchi for obstructing STF officers
byline: Five men and five women have been arrested for obstructing a group of Kilinochchi Police Special Task Force (STF) officers during a raid on an illegal alcohol operation in the Sudalakulam area of the Ramanathapuram Police Division, injuring two officers and freeing a suspect.

title: Magnitude 6.3 earthquake shakes Afghanistan’s Mazar-e Sharif city, casualties feared
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 6.3 struck near one of Afghanistan’s largest cities Mazar-e Sharif early on Monday, the U.S. Geological Survey said.

title: India crowned ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup champions
byline: India’s agonising wait for a maiden Women’s World Cup title finally came to an end as Harmanpreet Kaur and her teary-eyed teammates clinched the trophy by beating South Africa in a dramatic final at the DY Patil Stadium on Sunday.

title: One dead in motorcycle-car collision in Kitulgala
byline: A motorcyclist has reportedly died in a road accident near the 39th-kilometre post on the Hatton–Kitulgala road, in the Kitulgala Police Division.

title: Tuition classes targeting 2025 A/L exams prohibited from midnight tomorrow
byline: The 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination is scheduled to commence on November 10 and continue until December 5, the Commissioner General of Examinations, A. K. S. Indika Kumari Liyanage, said.

title: Two arrested for verbally abusing and threatening female Buddhist monk
byline: Two suspects have been arrested by Wattala Police for allegedly engaging in disorderly conduct in a public place in connection with an incident in which a female Buddhist monk was threatened and verbally abused.

title: Trump says China, other countries can’t have Nvidia’s top AI chips
byline: Artificial intelligence giant Nvidia’s most advanced chips will be reserved for U.S. companies and kept out of China and other countries, U.S. President Donald Trump said.

title: ‘Wana Surakuma’ joint operations unit to be established today
byline: The Ministry of Environment announced that the ‘Wana Surakuma’ Joint Operations Unit will be inaugurated today (03), with the objective of conserving Sri Lanka’s natural forest resources.

title: 16 killed, 8 injured as truck crashes into bus in India
byline: At least 16 people were killed and eight others suffered injuries when a tipper lorry carrying gravel collided head-on with a public transport bus in this district on Monday, police said.

title: SC dismisses writ petitions against freezing assets of Keheliya and family
byline: The Supreme Court has dismissed three writ petitions filed seeking to nullify the order issued by the Colombo High Court to freeze the assets belonging to former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and his family members.

title: Vatican Foreign Minister arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Archbishop Paul Richard Gallagher, the Secretary for Relations with States and International Organizations of the Holy See has arrived in Sri Lanka, a short while ago.

title: Woman who obstructed police officers on duty further remanded
byline: The woman seen in a video widely circulating on social media, obstructing and verbally abusing police officers on traffic duty in the Udugampola area, has been further remanded until November 10.

title: Organised criminal Welle Saranga’s close associate ‘Samaposha’ arrested
byline: An organized criminal gang member identified as ‘Madusanka’, who is also known by the alias ‘Samaposha’, has been arrested by the Colombo North Divisional Crime Investigation Bureau.

title: Trump’s global tariffs to face challenge before US Supreme Court
byline: The United States Supreme Court is set to hear arguments on Wednesday (Nov 5) on the legality of Donald Trump’s unprecedented use of powers for sweeping global tariffs in a case striking at the heart of the president’s economic agenda.

title: Youth arrested with ‘Kush’ cannabis worth over Rs. 21 mln at BIA
byline: A 28-year old Sri Lankan national has been arrested by officers of the Narcotics Control Unit (NCU) of Sri Lanka Customs for attempting to smuggle nearly 2.7 kilograms of ‘Kush’ cannabis into the country.

title: Six cannabis cultivations raided within forest reserve in Haldummulla
byline: Six cannabis cultivations within the Akkara Seeya Forest Reserve in Haldummulla have been raided by police, and six individuals who were guarding the cultivations have been arrested by the Haldummulla Police.

title: US$ 1.2 billion worth of vehicles imported in first 9 months, Sept. records highest expenditure
byline: Sri Lanka imported vehicles worth more than US$ 1.2 billion during the first nine months of 2025, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has confirmed.

title: Sri Lanka and Saudi Arabia discuss strengthening maritime cooperation
byline: Saudi Arabia has expressed willingness to enhance relations with Sri Lanka through technical collaboration, investment expansion, and knowledge exchange to modernize the fisheries and marine sectors.

title: Bail application of ‘Ali Roshan’ to be heard in December
byline: The Colombo High Court has scheduled a hearing for December 15 to consider the bail application filed by Samarappulige Niraj Roshan alias ‘Ali Roshan’, who has been sentenced to prison for being in possession of an elephant without a valid permit.

title: Two former senior state officials arrested on corruption charges
byline: Two former senior state officials have been apprehended on corruption charges by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: 35 Tamil Nadu fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: A total of 35 fishermen from Tamil Nadu have been arrested by the Sri Lankan Navy in the early hours of Monday (03) for crossing the International Maritime Boundary Line (IMBL) and fishing in Sri Lankan waters, Indian media reports state.

title: Rajarata University lecturers continue their strike action
byline: The Rajarata University Teachers’ Association has announced that it will continue the strike action until all its demands are fulfilled.

title: China to extend visa-free access to several countries
byline: China will extend its visa-free entry policy for several European countries, including France, until December 31, 2026, and will add Sweden to the scheme starting November 10, the Foreign Ministry announced Monday.

title: Trump says Russia, China have secretly tested nuclear weapons
byline: US President Donald Trump alleged on Sunday (Nov 2) that countries including Russia and China have conducted underground nuclear tests unknown to the public, and that the United States would follow suit.

title: Training institute in Mawanella suspended for issuing fake NVQ certificates
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment has temporarily suspended a training institute operating in Mawanella for allegedly issuing fraudulent NVQ certificates required for foreign employment.

title: One-day NIC service extended to Kurunegala office
byline: The one-day service for issuing National Identity Cards which was limited to the head office of the Department for Registration of Persons and the Galle office has been extended.

title: UGC to conduct inquiry into alleged sexual assault on female student by Wayamba University lecturer
byline: The University Grants Commission will conduct a formal investigation into an incident where a lecturer at the Wayamba University allegedly detained a female student in his residence and sexually assaulted her, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: Decision to extend school hours taken after discussions with all parties: PM Harini
byline: The decision to extend school hours by half an hour was taken after discussions with all relevant parties, including trade unions, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: India’s Adani Power opts for arbitration to settle payment dispute with Bangladesh
byline: India’s Adani Power said on Monday it has opted for an international arbitration process to resolve disputes over Bangladesh’s power supply payments.

title: Six arrested over seizure of 335kg of narcotics detained for questioning
byline: The six suspects, who were arrested in relation to the seizure of a multi-day fishing vessel with over 350 kilograms of crystal methamphetamine (‘Ice’) and heroin in seas off the western coast, have been detained for questioning.

title: Traffic restrictions along Colombo–Kandy road due to Central Expressway construction
byline: Vehicular movement along the Colombo–Kandy main road will be restricted in Kadawatha due to construction work related to the Central Expressway Project, Sri Lanka Police have announced.

title: Couple linked to ‘Dubai Kudu Dilini’ arrested in Kegalle
byline: A couple allegedly connected to a female drug trafficker known by the aliases ‘Dubai Kudu Dilini’ and ‘Kandy Queen’, who is believed to be operating a narcotics distribution network in Sri Lanka from Dubai, has been arrested.

title: Two senior state officials arrested by Bribery Commission granted bail
byline: Former General Manager of Sri Lanka Railways Sumathipala Mahanama and former Working Director of the Sri Lanka Engineering Corporation Sarathchandra Gunaratne who were arrested by the Bribery Commission earlier today have been granted bail.

title: Three-wheeler driver killed after being hit by train in Ragama
byline: The driver of a three-wheeler has died after being hit by a train near the Walpola railway station in Ragama.

title: OpenAI, Amazon strike $38 billion agreement for ChatGPT maker to use AWS
byline: Amazon.com will supply OpenAI with cloud computing services under a multi-year $38 billion deal, giving the ChatGPT maker access to hundreds of thousands of Nvidia graphics processors to train and run its artificial intelligence models.

title: Netherlands to return stolen ancient sculpture to Egypt
byline: The Netherlands has said it will return a stolen 3,500-year-old sculpture to Egypt.

title: GovPay processes over Rs. 1 billion in digital payments
byline: GovPay, a secure and user-friendly online platform designed to facilitate digital payments for Sri Lanka’s government services, has successfully processed over Rs. 1 billion in transactions, the Ministry of Digital Economy stated.

title: Tourist arrivals in October top 165,000
byline: A total of 165,193 tourists have arrived in the country in the month of October, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: ‘Wana Surakuma Joint Operations Centre’ launched to protect Sri Lanka’s forests
byline: The ‘Wana Surakuma Joint Operations Centre’, established with the aim of protecting Sri Lanka’s natural forest resources and combating forest crimes, was inaugurated today (03) at the Ministry of Environment premises.

title: Three-wheeler driver killed in accident near Moragahahena
byline: A three-wheeler driver has died following an accident near the Moragahahena town, where his vehicle overturned and collided with a car, police stated.
